Had the string bean chicken - I could tell the string beans were canned, and they used wayyy too much cooking oil. With less oil it would've been much better. That said, I ate it all. My buddy's garlic chicken was better but not amazing. So overall an "OK" spot for me.
author: Travis B.

description:
OMG! i love love love love LOVE henry's hunan.  i ate their harvest pork 2 twice for lunch this week.  i ate the left overs one additional time for breakfast.  ok, ok, and i have left overs from today's lunch that i'll probably eat tomorrow for breakfast too.  (can't wait!)

i also had their sweet and sour soup which was amazing.

this is my new favorite chinese food place which is saying a lot for me b/c i'm not that wild about chinese food.  

henry's uses no mgs and their ingredients are all fresh and healthy.  they're also really nice and the prices are reasonable.  i really can't imagine what else you could possibly want.

the reason i went to henry's in the first place was for their chinese chicken salad.  some fancy shmancy famous foodie chef who's opening a new restaurant in the mission said he was addicted to it.  that's a pretty good recommendation, huh?  i'll have to see about all that once i get past the harvest pork.
author: lori s.

description: Spent the weekend in San Francisco for Anniversary/Mothers Day/Foodfest. Was looking for a good place to have pork soup dumplings. This restaurant was listed, having them. Disappointed to find they didn't, but made the best of the situation. All the dishes we ordered were good and the service was very nice. It was quiet at the time and a nice atmosphere to the store front.
author: Rachelle Z.

description: Food was salty & Americanized. The spicy Rick cod fish needed hot chili oil, yet it still lacked flavor. Hubby had Harvest Pork which he & I specifically requested to be spicy but again it was not spicy. He described it as twice cooked pork with a fancy name. The curry vegetables had American vegetables so that was disappointing.  We were surrounded by non Asians. I think eating in Chinatown allows you better tasting food although the cleanliness & friendliness if this place cannot be beat.
author: Cherie O.

description:
This is the best Hunan food I've ever had in the US. The homemade spicy sauce is awesome. The meat sandwich, although localized in US, is good. I like the Hunan xiaochaorou and yuxiangrousi very much!

This is definitely somewhere you won't want to miss in SF. Try it!
author: Muxi L.

description: Wife and I had the beef pie appetizer which was very good. Also shared the garlic chicken and veggie chow mein. We had leftovers. Didn't break the bank. Nice restaurant, nice staff. Would definitely recommend to friends and family when visiting Chinatown :)
author: Bryan B.

description: What is happening here? I haven't been here in a month and it looks like an entirely new crew? Read the other reviews this month -where are Louis and Betty? Nobody knows and the lack of continuity with the front of the house and in the kitchen is disappointing - to be advised that none of the help can address what happened is a concern in itself - other diners got the same "I don't know"
author: Ruthie N.

description: We were looking for a  Chinese food restaurant last minute and we scored!!!  Our party of 8 (4 adults/4 kids)was greeted and sat immediately.  Our drinks came asap our waiter was friendly and  helped us choose dishes that made everyone happy. Food was expedited  quickly and tasted fantastic. Tasted healthier than your typical Chinese  restaurant too! Give this place  a try....you won't be disappointed!! I will be coming here next time I'm  in S.F.!
author: Vanessa P.

description: The food was very good. Finally I found a Kung Pao that is spicy enough. The service was very lacking. The waitress served our food then promptly disappeared and only reappeared when the water glasses were almost bone dry. Our friend had to go to desk to get the bill. I would of been a little more understanding if they were busy, but they only had 3 tables so no excuses.  I would of rated the food as 5 stars, but I couldn't justify the service.
author: Robin W.

description: Stopped here on our first night in San Francisco.  While many other restaurants in the area had over a 2 hour wait, we got right in here.  Food was good, but not the best I've ever had.  We really enjoyed the meat pie and the veggie fried rice.  Service was just ok, but with decent food, no wait, and low cost, I would consider coming here again for a quick meal.
author: Scott K.

description:
The place is fantastic: the food is delicious and the waiters are very nice and helpful. 

The five spice tofu is wonderful. The curry vegetables with tofu is the best example of its kind I've ever had (I think it's called dry curry).

The portions are very large (large enough for 2 meals if you aren't super hungry and take away the leftovers) and they give much better free tea than other places with free tea.

I think this is my favorite Chinese restaurant anywhere in the world!
author: Chad D.

description:
Wanted to like this place but none of our dishes were even just ok. Simply do not understand all the good reviews. 

Ham Fried rice was hardly fried. More like badly cooked crumbly white rice with bits of saltiest ham we've ever tasted. Did not work at all. Had no trace of "dragon breath" taste from a seasoned wok. Just bland rice with waaaay too salty ham.

Shrimp chow mien: noodles way over cooked and mushy. Again bland flavor and shrimp were definitely not fresh even though we were told they were. Shrimp was chopped into little pieces. Waaaay too much mushy cabbage. There was much more cabbage than noodle.

General Chicken:  mushy tasteless batter. Had no sweetness or hotness to it whatsoever. Mixed with terrible frozen broccoli.

Will not be going back, ever.
author: Glenn W.

description: Wow what can I say? The food was just spot on! We ordered fried rice, orange chicken, beef and broccoli, and chow mein. All Excellent but It was not just good the service was fast! They sat us down as we walked in got us our order and as soon as we knew it the food is arriving to our table. Awesome customer service very kind and welcoming people. Me and my girlfriends family came to San Francisco to tour and I honestly would recommend it to anyone coming here. Next time I come to San Francisco I'm stopping by for sure without a doubt. Even had my little brother loving it and he's a very picky eater as most kids, so I think that is all I have to say about this restaurant. Just amazing!
author: Isaac A.

description: Living near the area this is often a go-to spot for a quick dinner. I find this place is pretty good overall, and they have very friendly service both dining-in and to-go. The only caveat I have at this place is the additive onions or other "filler" shallots in many dishes. Otherwise the ingredients are pretty good!
author: Karl A.

description: Don't go here for a white tablecloth experience but it's the right spot for some awesome Veggie Kung Pao, Chow Mein and Mongolian Beef. Also not for those who cannot handle spicy food, it's pretty darn hot - whew! Maybe best value in North Beach. Long live King Henry!
author: Jesse J.

description: Amazing. Nice, quiet and the food was delivered quickly and was made fresh.  WE are visiting in town and wanted to get a nice meal before we went to a Giants game.  I have three boys, 20, 17 and 14 years.  Needless to say, they can eat.  We ordered two Orange Chicken, the Kung Pao Chicken, Broccoli Beef, Chicken and vegetables and two Chicken Chow Mein.  (I told you the boys could eat!  My wife, boys and I left very full and satisfied.  Our waiter was friendly and the service was fast.  We went in early so there was little crowd.  Good food, Good atmosphere and fresh clean facility.  Chinese as you would expect.
author: Mike R.

description:
I am so glad Henry's Hunan moved into the neighborhood - and approximately 100 feet from my house. 

Everyone here is incredibly friendly and the food is beautifully prepared.

Very fresh, loaded with veggies and not super heavy. They have lots of gluten free options (if you're into that kinda thing) and hardly any of the menu items are fried.

Soups are great to share. I love their hot and sour chicken, as well as the kung pao chicken. This one one of my favorite weekday places to grab dinner, when I don't feel like cooking.

YUM!
author: Caroline M.

description: Clean, quick service,friendly and attentive staff, and the food was perfect. What more could you want??? Seriously could not have asked for a nicer lunch. Henry's Rock Cod and the String Bean Chicken were big hits. Wife had Curry Tofu and left happy. Dumplings were fast and toasted just the way we like them. Thank you!
author: Kenneth C.

description: Found this place when House of Nanking was closed on CNY. Good and decent quality Chinese food is rare in SF. This is somewhat one of them. They don't use MSG and have great homemade chili dipping sauce (very important). I'd say it's on par with HoNK in that area. Try all the tofu dishes under the vegetarian menu, it's VERY good. One star less because I tried one of the noodle dishes and it disappointed me. Too much curry powder is cheating.... :)
author: May G.

description: We ordered different dishes and they were all very good. However, be aware that food is very spicy. I like spicy food, but medium is super hot, and probably mild is medium :-) Service was friendly and efficient. Good experience overall.
author: Karin B.

description: My mother loves Chinese food so I went there with her. The place is clean and friendly and has a great vibe to it. I was not rushed which is common in a lot of Chinese places, but I was rather given a great service where servers were helpful and very friendly. Despite being close to the fisher's wharf, the prices were very decent with a healthy portion of rice. I tried their chicken curry and the meat pie while mom tried kung Pao chicken and Chicken chow Mein. I was really surprised by how good everything tasted. I had some trouble parking but overall it's a great place to visit.
author: Osvaldo R.

description:
I am very excited that Henry's Hunan opened up in North Beach! I no longer have to schlep to Eliza's or Dragon Well for solid Chinese food. Yes, you'll get the classics here, but you'll also get curry chowmein and other unexpected delicious savories.

The food is fresh, staff is very friendly and warm, and restaurant is updated/modern and well taken care of. I was pleasantly surprised, that of all things on the menu that I could choose to fall in love with, their broccoli was just outstanding. Highly, highly recommend for casual dining and take out. Excellent food.
author: sarah m.

description: Great Chinese food!!! Dishes are authentic and very flavorful!! It's extremely clean has great service and nice ambiance! When I come back to San Francisco I definitely will come back here if I have a hankering for Chinese!
author: Arielle H.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in North Beach. I get it to go once a week and it is always delicious fast hot clean and friendly service. Everything I've tried on the menu is amazing. I specially love the Spicy Shrimp with bean curd and meat sauce.
author: Don j. c.

description: Not that good. The garlic chicken was incredibly bland and dumplings were way to doughy. Definitely skip.
author: Reba N.

description: Denitely bad serves!!!! The waitress asked to wait 30mins，we waited more than 1hr，we called back and another waiter said to offer us table，however，they didnt serve us table when we arrived the restaurant!!! Also without any apologizes!!! For God Sake!!!
author: Anigo W.

description:
My wife is allergic to msg so this was a great place to get some good Chinese food. We came in after the lunch hour rush so no problem to get a table and the food was very good and reasonably priced.
For no msg this is the place for you
author: N A.

description:
Great food and unexpected.
I was put off by the low number of reviews but was definitely pleasantly surprised.
author: Will Y.

description: This would be perfect if the food wasn't so salty. Not sure if we got unlucky or not, but we ordered 5 oversalted dishes.
author: Will Z.

description: Maybe we ordered the wrong things, but everything was just ok to me. We had the dumplings, egg rolls, won ton soup and Henry's special stir fry with white rice. The dumplings were very flavorful and my favorite thing we ordered. The won ton soup was very light and nothing special, I really wanted it to have more flavor. Everything else was just very average.
author: Allie H.

description: hot and sour was good. kung pao and the henry special was good also - a little too salty. we had kids with us and my one kid just wanted broccoli. they were very accommodating.
author: Johnny V.

description:
When I first arrived I was afraid the place might not be that great because it wasn't full. Quickly filled up with young families for dinner. No more than 10 tables in the restaurant, so consider making a reservation if you're coming after 7pm.

Very standard Chinese restaurant menu with no surprises or specialties. Clean and quiet space with a polite wait staff. The food was delicious, although I wish they had brought our party's plates out all together.

All in all a decent meal for a week night. Parking is horrendous around the area because of narrow streets packed with bars and restaurants. Expect to walk far or pay $15 flat rate for public parking garages.
author: Raven J.

description: so salty and all the dishes had an odd after taste.  party of six and we all left with the same sentiment, not great chinese food.
author: Noel J.

description: Owner is nice man, speaks English and Mandarin. Has a lunch special on menu. Exciting corner of North Beach people watching perfect. Delicious food.!!
author: Tina B.

description: I guess. i was expecting more after reading all the reviews. It was ok, not great food. very clean,but there is better food to be found in one of the many in Chinatown
author: Aubrey G.

description: After doing a extensive search for a special restaurant for dinner I came across Henry's. We were not disappointed. As other reviews have stated,the food was great, it's fresh and very well prepared. Service was good considering that they were very busy. It is a place that I would not have a problem returning to. Very sweet family run place.
author: Noel D.

description: This place is a great Chinese spot in North Beach! I frequently call in my order, walk down the hill, and it's ready.  I love the hot and sour soup and the dumplings.  I have eaten in the restaurant only once but the service was good.  The best part about Henry's Hunan to me is that the food doesn't taste bad when I get it to go (unlike some places).. it's not greasy.
author: Taylor P.

description: Excellent service. Very clean. Tasty food. Had Mongolian beef, beef and broccoli, and chicken chow mien.  All three were delicious.
author: Jackson P.

description:
This place rocked!
1. Atmosphere - quiet but really nice. Clean restaurant and the nicest server ever. Great place to have some dinner with friends and chat over drinks. 
2. Food - absolutely amazing!! I love Chinese and this place has quality food. No greasy feeling when you leave and plenty of veggies with every meat dish. I loved very bite.
I will definitely be back very soon. Thanks for an excellent dinner Henry's!
author: Margaret O.

description: Yelp you failed me again.   Ordered Won Ton Soup it was so bland salt water would of been a better broth.   When our waiter asked how it was I told him it was very bland.   His reply, " Its healthy.".  Healthy my ass it was water with two drops of soy sauce.   I thought we ordered pot stickers.  It was more like slop stickers.  Ordered the Spicy Curryr Chow Mein it was so bland the noodles were overcooked.  Another disappointment,  DAMN    Another disappointing dish was the Orange Chicken.  Seriously, Panda Express was way better.  Water was great and cold with ice.  Service was great the help were friendly and accommodatiing.    I think white people would love this place to death.
author: jeff a.

description:
My boyfriend and I live in North Beach, and this is the restaurant we frequent the most. Good food,  fast take-out, great ambiance, and EXCELLENT customer service.

My sister-in-law was recently in town for several days,  and we stopped by Hunan for take-out after a day on the town.  She loved the food and service so much she went back every night for the rest of her stay.  I think she wanted to pack up the place and take it home with her!

Highly recommended if you're looking for a pleasurable Chinese restaurant in the North Beach / Chinatown area.  Enjoy!
author: Crystal T.

description:
Ordered 4 dishes from the Chinese menu (no English translation) and they were all fantastic. This menu had only 15 dishes (3 of them had to be pre-ordered) but that's what I'll stick to, as I'm not a big fan of American Chinese food or Cantonese stir-fry dishes. However, if that's what you prefer, you can order from the English menu that has more choices and also seems to be very popular among locals. 

I liked their "targeting" strategy, enjoyed their generous portions, tasty food (although few dishes were a little too salty) and friendly service. Parking is a pain but it was worth it.
author: Lily X.

description: OK, so the food is very good but the service at the Grant St. location is non existent. We had lunch there on Sunday and there was only another family there. The wait staff delivered the food and we never saw them again. I had to even ask for the bill. They were just sitting there and never asked if we needed even more tea or water. The service at the downtown location is excellent.
author: Michael W.

description: Excellent Hunan food. Never overly sweet or greasy. Just good wholesome Chinese food. Everything I've tried has been delish!
author: Gina F.

description: Great dinner clean friendly and great service. For the price one of the best values in the area.
author: Michael M.

description: The previous Yelp reviews did not disappoint.  The food was absolutely delicious and I was pleasantly surprised when the bill arrived. I would have happily paid a bit more for less food.
author: Ryan M.

description: I really liked this place, clean and the meat pies were really tasty.  I didn't have any thing that blew me away, but the things we ordered were pretty damn good: wonton soup, meat pies, combo fried rice, and the smoked chicken and ham.  The dining area was pretty large too, unusual for sf.  This place is also in a great area, full of bars, places to eat, park, and church.
author: James F.

description:
Excellent food, good service, overall a great place!
We had the dumplings, Mongolian beef, Henry special, tofu, and everything was delicious. All dishes were less than $10. The only minor problem was that the food didn't arrive all at once. Must try!
author: Pedro R.

description: This seriously might be the best Kung Pao beef I've ever had - the half order of Mo Si soup I got was delicious as well! Combined with a Tsing Tao and a great meal was had! Will definitely come again when I'm town next!
author: Kyle L.

description: Excellent flavors. Started with wonton soup that was the best I have ever tasted.  The dumplings were very good and the Mongolian beef was exactly the way I like it, thin slices, not sweet, with a light sauce.  Definitely returning.
author: Judi R.

description: We dined here tonight based upon Yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint. It was very quiet, so service was very prompt and attentive. We had the Hunan Scallops, Chicken with Mixed Vegetables, Dumplings and Steamed Brown Rice. Very reasonable prices, most especially for San Francisco. The neighborhood is just a touch on the rough side, but nothing so serious as to prevent us from returning.
author: Steve A.

description: Two moms came here with two teenage boys. We all loved the dumplings!  The Chicken Chow Mein was spiced perfectly. Loved the Pulled Pork. The Hot and Sour Vegetables with added tofu was very delicious too.  The ambiance was crisp and clean and the staff was friendly and helpful.
author: Kate M.

description: This place came highly recommended through Time Out and the internet. All I have to say is EAT HERE. It will not disappoint. Not kidding, it was 100% the best Chinese food I have ever had in my life. It was my last meal of my San Francisco trip and I was over the moon about it. I said "wow" at least twenty times throughout the meal. The service was amazing and genuine. Louis was so sweet, gracious and had wonderful suggestions. The food was clean, fresh and the flavors were true parties in my mouth. One thing you must order are the Dumplings. Do not leave without them in your belly. I'm sad that I'm not at Henry's right now. :(
author: Katie D.

description:
Fantastic dumplings, great hot and sour beef.
The service was prompt and the meals were delivered on time except for the orange chicken whick came late...but WOW, it was worth the wait, w/o a doubt the best I've ever had!
author: Brian M.

description: Took a walk through China Town and landed at Henry's for dinner for two adults and two kids.  Started out with Dumplings and Meat Pie.  Meat pie was fantastic!   That was new to me but everyone loved it.  For the main course, we had Mu Shu chicken and spicy fried food. Both were hits!  Very friendly service and reasonable prices.  Solid all the way around.
author: Don S.

description: This Restaurant is UNBELIEVABLY GOOD!  We had just arrived in San Fran at 7pm-ish.  We waited to eat, because we wanted our friend to recommend a place for a late dinner.  He recommends Henry's but they are about 15 minutes from closing time, by the time we get there.  We reluctantly walked in and were welcomed with smiles and excitement that we arrived.  I hate being "that group", but they acted like there were hours before closing.  I was already impressed.  We sat, ordered a nice bottle of Sauvignon Blanc, and I ordered a beer.  I ordered the Henry's special and my GF ordered the beef and string peas along with a serving of pork fried rice.  The Food was perfect.  It came out promptly and was piping hot.  The rice was some of the best pork fried rice that I have EVER had and the house made Hunan sauce has my mouth watering as I type this!  LITERALLY.  Henry's was the absolutely PERFECT way to start our trip off right.  We left in great moods, full of great food, and laughing and smiling.  I can't wait to visit my friends on the West Coast again and part of that reason is so I can enjoy Henry's Hunan again!!!!!!!!!  Every one should go here!
author: Brian H.

description: Both locations rock!!!! Simply marvelous food! We eat at one or the other every time we go!!!!! Nice staff. Clean. Smells so amazing all the time. Go hungry. Hunan Sausage Extra Spicy is a must!!!! Every dish we have had, has been extremely tasty!!! No complaints for either location!
author: Jake B.

description: We came in here because of the high YELP rating, and we weren't disappointed.  We tried the dishes everyone talked about and had a nice lunch.  The meat pies (so not traditional Chinese) were light and fluffy and tasty, the Hot and Sour soup was both, and probably the best of that I have ever had.  The Kung Pao beef was average, but overall we had tons of food, great service, and would send my friends there in a heartbeat.
author: Andy L.

description: We came here for a late lunch and we're met with a clean and inviting atmosphere, kind service, lovely complimentary Jasmine tea and a delicious and hearty meal. I had the Combination Chow Mein with a side order of Chicken Fried Rice and my husband had the Mongolian Chicken that he loved.
author: DK J.

description: Does not earn high marks for food, ambience, service, nor authenticity.  Only for those looking for mediocre americanized chinese food.  Not coming back...
author: Z Z.

description: Wonderful, fast service! Great food, especially dumplings and meat pie! Other dishes must be good the place was packed for lunch, but they have extra room up top to accommodate overflow. Would definitely recommend!
author: Bunny P.

description: I've been eating at Henry's for 27 years! Since before the earthquake at the original Kearny location. This place is the real deal. Authentic country dishes, cooked with all freshly prepared ingredients, at extremely reasonable prices. This is the newest and maybe fanciest location. If you are a tourist in San Francisco, eating at Henry's Hunan is a must.
author: Orlando S.

description: Very Good with a great atmosphere. We had the Meat Pie, Beef and Broccoli, Sweet & Sour Pork, And Chicken Chow Mein. The meat pie had an Asian-Mexican fusion flare; it was light, crispy, and delicious. The beef and broccoli was cooked to perfection. The sweet-and-sour pork was excellent, as was the chow mein.
author: Josh H.

description: Authentic Hunanese food cooked by Hunan chefs. We are very surprised by their standard, even better than many restaurants from our hometown! -Customers from Changsha, Hunan
author: Yiqi Z.

description: Fantastic!  The hot and sour soup is the best I have had anywhere in the world.  I have yet to order anything that wasn't delicious. No wonder it is so highly rated.
author: John M.

description:
How to lose potential customers:
  1) Have an inadequate number of food servers
  2) Have your customers wait 25 minutes to place their order
  3) Have other parties seated AFTER you, served their food well BEFORE you 
  4) Put a check on the table with simply a  $$ total--no indication on the check of 
       specific menu items and their prices

Congratulations Henry's on Grant!  You passed this demanding test of how a restaurant loses customers.  Job well done.
author: richard h.

description: Love this place. Came on a whim after Chinese New Years parade. It was warm and inviting in a cold San Fran night. The food is all good - love love loved the spicy curry noodles, Henry's special, and bean curd with beef.
author: Sara T.

description: Delicious food! Loved the sweet and sour chicken, and the Henry's special was also yummy.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Food was ok--but just ok.  nothing special.  we ate at the Henry's in north Beach on Grant and Green.
author: Jim M.

description: This place has good food, I would recommend to my friends. Loved the meat pie, something you really don't see in a Chinese restaurant tho.... kung pao chicken was super spicy, good but too spicy for me.
author: Mishel N.

description: Awesome food. Meat pie was unusual offering but superb. Smoked meats are fantastic. Service is suspect and slow but food makes up for it. Some of the best Chinese around.
author: Kenny S.

description: Great place, thanks Louis! Delicious food, incredible service, and pleasurable ambient environment. Highly recommend.
author: Vincent C.

description:
Here are my "bona fides":   I have been a fan of Henry Chung's Hunan restaurants since 1979 when I first moved to the Bay Area and I used to go to his original little place on Kearny Street (man, I miss that place).  I've eaten a million times at the big place on Sansome over the years, which is good, but not Kearny Street good.  I've also eaten at virtually every Hunan restaurant from SF to SJC.  I dined at the new Henry's Hunan on Grant Street for the first time last night.  I give it 9.7 Kearnys out of 10!  I'm honestly not sure if it really deserves to fall short of a full 10 Kearny rating.  It may just be that nothing will ever be able to match my memory of the Kearny location.   You're probably getting the idea that I liked it.  Not only was the food the best Hunan cuisine I've had in a long time (and compared with some pretty fine food at other places), but the restaurant is really nicely appointed, and located on a really cute little section of Grant Ave.  It is North Beach, not Chinatown, but if you are looking for a fun place to walk around before and after dinner - or a real authentic old San Francisco atmosphere for your tourist friends, take them here.  It is, of course, spicy.  But we asked them for 'medium hot' because one of our party was not into ring stingers, and they hit perfectly.  Go.  Go now.  This is my new favorite Chinese restaurant.

Update upon latest visit: ..and this is mostly in hope that the restaurant will read it.  Two things:  First Hunan Smoked Ham might be my favorite food in the whole world.  I have it at every Hunan restaurant I visit.  I've made it myself from the recipe of Henry Chung himself.  I'm actually eating it right now as I write this - take out from a little place in San Jose (8.8 Kearneys), but I digress.  Second I love salty food.  I salt food that other people think is too salty.  I love me some salt.  But, on my last visit, the Hunan Smoked Ham was INSANELY salty.   Not so salty that I couldn't eat it, but nobody else at the table could, and I didn't enjoy it. Seriously, you need to find a way to cut down on the saltiness because it was nearly inedible the last time.  Maybe it was just a bad night, and i'll try it again, but it would be a deal breaker for me if it is always that way.  Everything else was delicious.
author: Vernon M.

description: Honestly not exaggerating when I say that this is the best Hunan food I have had in San Francisco. Hot and Sour soup is fantastic, same with pot stickers, Hunan shredded pork is great as well, but really I have not had a dish I did not like. Everything tastes very fresh, and has a lot of flavor.
author: Steve S.

description: Really nice and clean restaurant.  The menu is completely in English, so for those of you who need to know what the Mandarin/Cantonese name of the dishes are for ease of ordering, just ask the waiter.  The cold noodles were good but I found the peanut sauce to be a little too overwhelming (i.e. there was too much of it).  We also got a spicy tofu dish that I.  could.  not.  handle.  So spicy.  But in a good way!
author: Jess H.

description: This place was absolutely delicious! A must try if you are busying San Francisco. If I was luckily enough to live here I would make this my up to chinese restaurant. Staff extremely friendly. Food was hot and fresh! Definitely will make this my first stop when I come back!
author: Stu S.

description: Incredibly mediocre. Bland tasteless and salty. Marty's Special was smoky and uninteresting.
author: Ted B.

description: Good Chinese food for a place in north beach. The restaurant is clean and the staff is very friendly. Prices very reasonable too.
author: Andy C.

description: I'm very happy to finally have a good Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood. We had the spicy rock cod, Mongolian beef, Marti's Special and sautéed broccoli. The dishes were all great, and the three of us left stuffed (and with leftovers). Service is friendly and efficient, and the restaurant is clean and modern. We will put this on the list of neighborhood go-to spots.
author: melita s.

description: The service was great but the item I ordered (Henry's shredded pork) was so salty I actually stopped eating it and left before feeling full
author: Eric M.

description: Definitely try the meat pie appetizer and their specials. Service was overwhelmed and really slow the time we went.
author: Tyson C.

description: Fantastic food and better atmosphere than you would expect from a typical Chinese restaurant. The service was friendly, but a little scarce as it got crowded. Overall  highly recommended
author: Adam C.

description: I'm not usually a big Chinese fan, but this place is changing my mind. Highest quality Chinese food I've had in the Bay Area!
author: Dan W.

description: The most authentic Chinese(Hunanese) restaurant I've ever had in San Francisco! It's clean and comfortable. And the neighborhood is pretty nice, too. We had 3 dishes, loved them all! Highly recommend spicy and sour beef! The manager was super friendly and hospitable, he even offered us free drinks and soups.  We had a good time here, definitely gonna come here often!
author: Madisyn L.

description: Authentic Hunan cuisine.  Try the Marty's special if you can stand a little heat.  Very happy to have it in the neighborhood!
author: Chas J.

description: One of the better Chinese Food places in North Beach/FiDi.  Great for pickup or dine in with a small group
author: Jake H.

description: Went to HH for Mother's Day. Not only was the food great - tried the Marty's special this time - but the decor and service make it a place to go for a special occasion. I would also recommend the Shredded Pork.
author: Tim K.

description: Dropped by here for lunch with some coworkers for the first time. It wasn't too busy so we were able to get seated right away. While they do have lunch specials on the menu, there was not a lot of options to choose from so I decided to just get a regular dish. I ordered the spicy eggplant with meat sauce and an order of brown rice. Our server asked how spicy I wanted, which is always nice and I said mild. After everyone ordered, we all got complimentary hot and sour soup! =) I'm usually not a big fan of this type of soup but it was surprisingly pretty tasty and not overly spicy like some can be. Food arrived fairly quickly and everyone's dish was pretty big, including my eggplant dish! Our white and brown rice came in 2 big bowls for everyone to share. The eggplant was really good!! It was perfectly spiced and seasoned, and the sauce it came with was pretty yummy. It paired really well with the brown rice. By the end of our lunch, we were all so stuffed and almost all of us had to doggy bag our leftovers back to the office! For the price, portions, and quality of the food here, I would definitely  recommend this place to anyone who is craving some good Chinese food! =)
author: Mary C.

description: Excellent food, everything tasted so fresh and wonderfully spiced.  Also very clean and great service. We'll be back for sure.
author: David H.

description: I had walked in front of this place several times. It was only after a cold that I felt the need for hot and sour soup. The waiter told me he was going to give me a small bowl, as well as a small plate of Hunan-style smoked ham fried rice. Imagine my surprise at the size of this bowl. And it has so much tofu, bamboo shoots and mushrooms. It was a meal in itself.
author: François L.

description: from the minute i walked in till the minute i left everything was perfect...i had a simple order veggie chow mein and veggie egg rolls..perfect!Not a big fan of chinese food but i will definitly visit next time I'm in town
author: sweden a.

description: First time here. Came for lunch for 5 and ordered Onion Cake and Meat Pie for appetizers. They were different, interesting and tasty. Then we shared Velvet Chicken, Orange Chicken and Smoked Ham Chow Mein with Boiled White Rice. Everything was cooked nicely and spiced delicately. Service was friendly. Would come back any time :)
author: Paul C.

description: Finally- great Chinese food in North Beach! Everything we had was good, but the Meat Pie is a must.
author: Rose H.

description: So good! Haven't found a decent Chinese restaurant in SF since I moved 8 months ago. Even though Chinatown is so close all the places look sketchy. This place is super clean, amazing customer service and good was delish! Came out fresh and hot. Def going to be a regular
author: Erin W.

description: My family was unimpressed with our visit to Henry's. The food was nothing special, just different stir fries and varied sauces. We ordered Henry's shredded pork, dry-sauteed string beans, and Henry's special and they were all a little too salty.
author: A N.

description: I am from Hunan. I was so excited when I found this place on my first day in San Fran as it's written in Chinese on the window that they have authentic Hunan dishes. I went in and asked the owner told me they aren't necessarily in the menu but I can order whatever I used to have at home. During my stay in SF I was there twice having only pork with green chili and it soooo good exactly what I had in China, spicy though I love spicy cuz I'm from Hunan haha. Plus the owner's super friendly
author: Lai J.

description: I was happy to see a new one open up in my hood.  I walked in and was happy to be greeted by the same waitress and waiter from the Sacramento location.    Same good food.   Recommend the dumpling and Henry's Special.
author: John C.

description: It is a great place to try real HUNAN flavor! People there are very nice. It is the first choice if I would like to have some spicy food.
author: Yilin Z.

description: orange chicken here is the beez kneez. chow mein is perfect. i've been walking by this location too long. glad I finally stopped in. it's a regular pick up lunch spot for me now, right up the street from work.
author: Wayne B.

description: Best hot and sour soup I have had in years. Lunch specials very flavorful and a bargain for the price. Excellent preparation. Spicy dishes are spicy but not overwhelming. The chef has it precisely right. We'll be eating here again.
author: Jon F.

description: One of the best Chinese food...freshness, good spicyness and good service.  We asked for some to be made extra spicy and they still tasted hunan...well done.
author: Hussain H.

description: Service started off good but waited a long time for my food. Tried the meat pie whack was great. Not sure it is really Chinese but still good and very filling. Had the fried rice that was ok. Nothing great. Hot and sour soup was very good.  I may come back but more likely to try some where else. Oh, there is also a strange smell. Like the place is musty... smelt of some where old.
author: Nick P.

description: Very, very good.  The greeting and service was friendly.  We had mongolian beef and mu shu pork, which were both excellent.  The restaurant itself is very clean, the owners like to know your names and couldn't be nicer.  Welcome to North Beach, Henry's!  I will certainly be back to visit after my cocktails in Gino & Carlo's.
author: Cynthia C.

description: This is a must try especially if you are a local like me! The staff is so nice and friendly! The ambiance is clean and beautiful! The egg rolls and combination noodle dish were excellent!! This is a great gem in SF where truly good chinese food can be hard to find.
author: Elle J.

description: Really good food. Nothing more to be said, really. Go here if you want good Hunan. Try the meat pies.
author: Dwayne W.

description: In short, this is the best Chinese restaurant I have ever eaten at in terms of food. Everything tasted fresh, without the heaviness that accompanies many Chinese American establishments. Of particular note are the veggie egg rolls and garlic chicken. The service was friendly and fast with the decor slightly minimal, but clean. I was extremely happy to bring my guests from out of town here and find my new favorite Asian restaurant in town.
author: Raffi M.

description: My family and I had dinner here on our vacation and we all loved this  place.  Great food , reasonably priced.  We liked it so much we came back two nights later.
author: Denise M.

description: Probably one of the best tasting Chinese restaurant around China town. However I wish they give you two boxes when you order to go so your rice is not buried under all the goodies and impossible to reach.
author: Wokeke P.

description: Easily the best Chinese Restaurant experience I've had in years.  The place was clean (almost spotless) and aesthetically pleasing (good layout), the staff were very friendly and attentive, and the food was incredible (I got the Garlic Chicken. Highly recommended.
author: Michael S.

description: New, clean, friendly.   Beef with green onions and garlic chicken was delicious.  Completely affordable at $35 for two people including drinks.  Will definitely return.
author: Alex B.

description: I'm so happy Henry's Hunan has moved into the neighborhood.  The restaurant is clean, and the wait staff was really friendly and attentive.  The food was also fresh and delicious, especially the dumplings,  chicken with black bean sauce,  and string beans.  I also liked the brown rice option. I suspect this will be a regular go to place for me.
author: Grace K.

description: great to have these guys at a nice new bright location with the food as good as it ever was.
author: Lucy Z.
